Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and test it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then no matter how strange the behavior, i know what change caused it.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: think about it. how often is the cause for a bug in a totally different area of code than made sense based on the bug? Quite often. So if you have two or N such bugs at the same time, it becomes  unknowable what code change led to what bug

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and most of all keep the code as simple as possible, everywhere possible. complexity is the enemy

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: even with that the entire system will become quite complex. better to have a lot of simple components, than one giant complex beast

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: Question: (I know you have said KV is being replaced by Oracles CC but I'd still like to use it for something..) I've talked to a few members that stated that KV values used to be printed to stdout from mempool before the actual block was mined. It was disabled at some point. Would you be able to point me in the right direction to re-enable them?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
komodo_kv.h 175?:                 //fprintf(stderr,"KV add.(%s) (%s)\n",ptr->key,valueptr);
uncomment that line

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it will show new KV entries being added

Author: Alright#0419
Content: so if we can't get it printing from mempool, I thought of a dirty hack that would work

Author: Alright#0419
Content: we can create an on-demand blocks chain and force it to have a static easy diff then dpow it with staked

Author: Alright#0419
Content: that way, as soon as a message hits mempool, it will be mined and the diff won't raise after many messages

Author: Alright#0419
Content: and with dpow it can't be reorged, so I don't see easy diff as a problem

Author: Alright#0419
Content: seems like a really round-about way to accomplish what we need though

Author: Alright#0419
Content: actually might be a good test for what @blackjok3r has been working on

Author: Alright#0419
Content: he's been fixing the StakedNotary repo so that we can have chains with different consensus rules

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @jl777c what do you think about the above idea? Static easy diff on-demand blocks chain, so txs always mined immediately

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sure

Author: Alright#0419
Content: seems easy enough to do, but like I said very round-about way to accomplish what we need

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: more experimentation more experience more better

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: nothing wrong with getting what you need done with least effort, regardless of where the effort is

Content: need to find the checks that reject blocks with lower diff than target and remove them

Content: need to find where that grabs the target from

Author: Kalash#2884
Content: Referring to the recent announcement by VerusCoin. What is to stop a malicious actor from gaining large enough control and "finding" their own attempt to cheat the stake reward? This system essentially gives them a legitimate way to create coins by discovering their own attempt to cheat. Additionally, what does this do the the total block reward over time?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: doesnt change the blockreward at all

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: well if someone cheats and then discovers their own cheat, what did they gain?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: they gained a mining reward, and then lost it and then gained it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so net gain of 1 reward instead of 1 reward

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this maliciousness seems quite misguided with a ROI of 0%, even if it works

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and they are competing against the entire rest of the network to mine the cheat claim, so odds are very good they wont recover the stake they put up
